intro: Cissampelopsis quinquesquamata, commonly known as the five-armed climbing plant, is a woody vine native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation projects.
